intro: Centaurea assadii, commonly known as the Assad's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Centaurea assadii is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
